recipes.name: Butter Chicken
recipes.description: Creamy tomato-based chicken curry. India's most popular export dish worldwide.

steps.instruction: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, and salt for 2 hours.
Grill or pan-fry marinated chicken until charred. Set aside.
Melt butter in a pan. Add tomato puree and cook for 10 minutes until oil separates.
Add garam masala and sugar. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add grilled chicken pieces. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add cream and kasuri methi. Simmer for 3 minutes. Finish with butter.

recipes.name: Dal Makhani
recipes.description: Rich and creamy black lentils slow-cooked overnight. A Punjabi classic.

steps.instruction: Soak dal and rajma overnight. Pressure cook until very soft.
Mash some dal to make it creamy.
Heat butter, add ginger-garlic paste and sauté.
Add tomato puree, chili powder. Cook until oil separates.
Add cooked dal. Simmer on low heat for 30-45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add cream, garam masala, kasuri methi, and butter. Simmer 5 more minutes.

recipes.name: Chole Bhature
recipes.description: Spicy chickpea curry with fluffy fried bread. Iconic North Indian breakfast.

steps.instruction: Soak chickpeas overnight. Pressure cook with tea bags until soft (for dark color).
Make bhatura dough with flour, yogurt, salt, and water. Rest for 2 hours.
Sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes.
Add chole masala and cooked chickpeas. Mash some chickpeas for thick gravy.
Simmer for 20 minutes. Add amchur for tanginess.
Roll bhatura and deep fry until puffed and golden.

tips: Tea bags give authentic dark color

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
recipes.description: Cottage cheese cubes in creamy spinach gravy. Healthy and delicious.

steps.instruction: Blanch spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes. Transfer to ice water. Blend to smooth puree.
Cut paneer into cubes. Lightly fry until golden. Set aside.
Heat butter, add cumin and garlic. Sauté until fragrant.
Add chopped onion and tomato. Cook until soft.
Add spinach puree, green chilies, and salt. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes, cream, and garam masala. Cook for 3 minutes.

recipes.name: Rajma Chawal
recipes.description: Kidney bean curry served with rice. A Punjabi comfort food classic.

steps.instruction: Soak rajma overnight. Pressure cook until completely soft.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 2 minutes.
Add pureed tomatoes, chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until oil separates.
Add cooked rajma with its water. Mash some beans for thick gravy.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Add garam masala and garnish with coriander.

tips: Mashing some beans thickens the gravy

recipes.name: Aloo Paratha
recipes.description: Stuffed potato flatbread. The king of North Indian breakfasts.

steps.instruction: Make soft dough with flour, salt, and water. Rest for 20 minutes.
Boil, peel, and mash potatoes. Mix with all spices, onion, and coriander.
Divide dough and filling into equal portions.
Roll dough circle, place filling, seal edges, and roll gently into a circle.
Cook on hot tawa with ghee until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with butter on top.

tips: Filling should be dry, not wet
Don't roll too thin or it will tear
Use generous ghee for crispy paratha

recipes.name: Dal Tadka
recipes.description: Yellow lentils with aromatic tempering. Everyday Indian comfort food.

steps.instruction: Pressure cook dal with turmeric, tomato, and salt until soft.
Mash the dal lightly and adjust water for desired consistency.
Heat ghee in a small pan. Add cumin seeds and let splutter.
Add dried red chilies, sliced garlic, and green chili. Sauté until garlic is golden.
Add onion and chili powder. Cook for a minute.
Pour this tadka over the dal. Garnish with coriander.

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken
recipes.description: Yogurt-marinated chicken grilled to perfection. Smoky, charred, and irresistible.

steps.instruction: Make deep cuts in chicken. Apply lemon juice and salt. Rest 15 minutes.
Mix yogurt with all spices, ginger-garlic paste, and mustard oil.
Apply marinade generously, getting into all cuts. Refrigerate for 4-6 hours.
Preheat oven to 220°C or prepare grill.
Cook chicken for 25-30 minutes, basting with butter occasionally.
For charred flavor, broil for last 5 minutes. Serve with lemon and onions.

tips: Baste with butter for moist chicken

recipes.name: Paneer Tikka
recipes.description: Marinated and grilled cottage cheese cubes with vegetables. Popular vegetarian starter.

steps.instruction: Cut paneer and vegetables into 1.5 inch cubes.
Mix yogurt with all spices, ginger-garlic paste, oil, and salt.
Add paneer and vegetables to marinade. Rest for 30 minutes.
Thread onto skewers alternating paneer and vegetables.
Grill or bake at 200°C for 15-20 minutes, turning once.
Sprinkle chaat masala and lemon juice. Serve hot.

tips: Don't over-marinate or paneer becomes soft
Can be cooked on a regular pan too

recipes.name: Kadhi Pakora
recipes.description: Tangy yogurt curry with crispy gram flour fritters. Punjabi comfort food.

steps.instruction: Make pakora batter with half the besan, chopped onion, salt, and water. It should be thick.
Deep fry small portions to make pakoras. Set aside.
Whisk yogurt with remaining besan, turmeric, chili powder, and 3 cups water.
Boil this mixture on medium heat, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
Heat ghee, add cumin, fenugreek, red chilies, and curry leaves.
Add tempering to kadhi. Add pakoras and simmer for 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Keema Matar
recipes.description: Spiced minced meat with green peas. Hearty North Indian classic.

steps.instruction: Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add minced meat, break up lumps. Cook on high heat for 5 minutes.
Add spices and peas. Cover and cook until meat is done.
Add garam masala and garnish with coriander.

tips: Use freshly minced meat for best texture
Cook on high heat initially for browning

recipes.name: Malai Kofta
recipes.description: Paneer-potato dumplings in creamy tomato gravy. Royal vegetarian indulgence.

steps.instruction: Boil and mash potatoes. Grate paneer. Mix with corn flour and salt to make dough.
Shape into balls, stuffing with a cashew each. Deep fry until golden.
Soak cashews. Blend onion, tomatoes, and cashews to smooth paste.
Heat oil, add paste and cook for 10 minutes. Add spices.
Add water for desired consistency. Simmer with kasuri methi.
Add cream. Place koftas in gravy just before serving.

tips: Add koftas to gravy just before serving to keep them firm
Fry koftas on medium heat for even cooking
Gravy should be rich and creamy

recipes.name: Aloo Gobi
recipes.description: Spiced potatoes and cauliflower. Simple, healthy, and satisfying.

steps.instruction: Cut cauliflower into florets and potatoes into cubes.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Add onion and sauté until light brown.
Add ginger and green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add potatoes and cook covered for 5 minutes.
Add cauliflower, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt. Cover and cook until tender.
Add tomato and garam masala. Cook 3 more minutes. Garnish with coriander.

tips: Don't add water - cook on low heat
Don't stir too much or cauliflower will break
Can add kasuri methi for extra flavor

recipes.name: Shahi Paneer
recipes.description: Cottage cheese in rich, creamy cashew-tomato gravy. Fit for royalty.

steps.instruction: Soak cashews in warm water. Blend onion, tomatoes, and cashews to smooth paste.
Heat ghee, add cardamom. Add onion-tomato paste and cook 10 minutes.
Add ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, and salt. Cook 3 minutes.
Add water for desired consistency. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add cream, saffron, and garam masala. Simmer 2 minutes.

tips: Fry paneer lightly for better texture
Adjust sweetness with sugar if needed

recipes.name: Kashmiri Rogan Josh
recipes.description: Aromatic lamb curry with distinctive red color. Pride of Kashmiri cuisine.

steps.instruction: Heat ghee, add whole spices. Add sliced onions and cook until golden.
Add lamb pieces and sear on high heat for 5 minutes.
Add Kashmiri chili powder (mixed with little water). Cook for 2 minutes.
Add ginger and fennel powder. Mix well.
Add whisked yogurt gradually, stirring constantly.
Add water to cover meat. Cover and cook until tender (45-50 minutes).

tips: Kashmiri chili gives color without excessive heat
Don't rush the cooking - slow cook for tender meat

recipes.name: Seekh Kebab
recipes.description: Spiced minced meat skewers grilled to perfection. Mughlai delicacy.

steps.instruction: Finely chop onion, chilies, coriander, and mint.
Mix mince with all ingredients except oil. Knead well for 5 minutes.
Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Wet hands and shape mixture around skewers into elongated kebabs.
Grill on charcoal or in oven at 200°C, turning and basting with oil.
Serve hot with green chutney and onion rings.

tips: Fat content in mince is important for juiciness

recipes.name: Paneer Butter Masala
recipes.description: Cottage cheese in rich butter tomato gravy. Restaurant favorite made at home.

steps.instruction: Soak cashews and blend to paste.
Heat butter, add ginger-garlic paste. Sauté for a minute.
Add tomato puree and cook for 10 minutes until oil separates.
Add cashew paste, chili powder, salt, and sugar. Cook 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add cream, kasuri methi, and garam masala. Finish with butter.

tips: Don't skip kasuri methi - it's essential

recipes.name: Matar Paneer
recipes.description: Cottage cheese and green peas in tomato-onion gravy. Everyday favorite.

steps.instruction: Puree onions and tomatoes separately.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Add onion puree and cook until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and spices. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add peas and water. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and garam masala. Simmer 3 minutes. Garnish with coriander.

tips: Use fresh peas for best taste
Can add cream for richer gravy

recipes.name: Baingan Bharta
recipes.description: Smoky roasted eggplant mash with onions and tomatoes. Rustic and flavorful.

steps.instruction: Roast eggplants directly on flame until charred and soft inside.
Cool, peel, and mash the roasted eggplant. Remove excess water.
Heat mustard oil, add cumin seeds and garlic.
Add chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add mashed eggplant, spices, and salt. Cook 5 minutes. Garnish with coriander.

tips: Char the eggplant well for smoky flavor
Mustard oil is traditional - gives authentic taste
Can be made in oven if no gas stove

recipes.name: Jeera Rice
recipes.description: Fragrant cumin-tempered rice. Perfect accompaniment to any curry.

steps.instruction: Wash and soak rice for 20 minutes. Drain well.
Heat ghee in a pot. Add cumin, bay leaf, cloves, and cinnamon.
When cumin sizzles, add drained rice. Sauté gently for 2 minutes.
Add 3 cups water and salt. Bring to boil.
Cover and cook on low heat for 12-15 minutes until rice is done.
Let it rest 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving.

tips: Don't skip the soaking for fluffy rice
1:2 rice to water ratio works well

recipes.name: Gajar ka Halwa
recipes.description: Warm carrot pudding with khoya and nuts. Winter's favorite dessert.

steps.instruction: Grate carrots finely.
Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add carrots and cook on medium heat.
Stir frequently until milk is absorbed (about 25-30 minutes).
Add ghee and sauté for 5 minutes until slightly golden.
Add sugar and khoya. Mix well and cook until sugar dissolves.
Add cardamom and garnish with fried nuts and raisins.

tips: Use red carrots for authentic color

recipes.name: Rice Kheer
recipes.description: Creamy rice pudding flavored with cardamom and saffron. Traditional Indian dessert.

steps.instruction: Wash and soak rice for 30 minutes.
Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan, stirring frequently.
Add drained rice. Cook on low heat, stirring often until rice is very soft.
Add sugar and mix until dissolved.
Add saffron soaked in warm milk and cardamom.
Garnish with chopped nuts and raisins. Serve warm or chilled.

tips: Milk should reduce to half for creamy texture
Can add rose water for extra flavor

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
recipes.description: Grilled chicken in rich, creamy spiced tomato gravy. Restaurant favorite worldwide.

steps.instruction: Marinate chicken with yogurt, half the spices, and salt. Rest 2 hours or overnight.
Grill or pan-fry chicken tikka until charred and cooked. Set aside.
Heat butter and oil. Sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, remaining spices. Sauté for 2 minutes.
Add tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.
Add chicken tikka and cream. Simmer for 5 minutes.

recipes.name: Mutton Rogan Josh
recipes.description: Aromatic Kashmiri mutton curry with signature red color from Kashmiri chilies.

steps.instruction: Heat ghee. Add whole spices and asafoetida.
Add mutton pieces. Sear on high heat until browned.
Add Kashmiri chili powder mixed with little water. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add whisked yogurt gradually, stirring continuously.
Add fennel powder, ginger powder, salt, and water. Cover and cook.
Simmer on low heat until mutton is tender (45-50 minutes).
Finish with garam masala. Rest before serving.

recipes.name: Amritsari Fish
recipes.description: Crispy batter-fried fish with ajwain. Iconic Punjabi street food.

steps.instruction: Cut fish into fingers or chunks. Pat dry.
Marinate with lemon juice, ginger-garlic, turmeric, salt for 20 min.
Make batter with besan, rice flour, chili powder, ajwain, and water.
Heat oil for deep frying.
Dip fish in batter and fry until golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with chutney.

recipes.name: Lucknowi Chicken Korma
recipes.description: Rich, creamy chicken curry with nuts and cream. Awadhi royal cuisine.

steps.instruction: Soak cashews and melon seeds. Grind to smooth paste.
Slice onions. Fry until deep golden. Grind half to paste.
Heat ghee. Add whole spices. Add remaining fried onions.
Add chicken. Sear until sealed.
Add yogurt, onion paste, nut paste. Cook covered.
Add cream, white pepper, saffron. Simmer until thick.

recipes.name: Mutton Do Pyaza
recipes.description: Mutton curry with double onions - in the gravy and as garnish. Mughlai classic.

steps.instruction: Slice 3 onions fine, quarter 2 onions for garnish.
Fry sliced onions until deep brown. Set aside half for later.
Add ginger-garlic paste, spices. Sauté.
Add mutton. Sear on high heat.
Add yogurt and tomatoes. Cook covered until mutton is tender.
Add quartered onions and reserved fried onions. Cook 5 more min.
Finish with garam masala.

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken
recipes.description: Smoky, charred chicken marinated in yogurt and spices. Iconic Punjabi dish.

steps.instruction: Make deep cuts in chicken. Apply salt and lemon. Rest 30 min.
Mix yogurt with all spices and mustard oil.
Apply marinade generously, into cuts too. Marinate 4-6 hours.
Preheat oven to 220°C or prepare grill.
Cook chicken for 25-30 minutes, turning once, until charred.
Baste with butter. Serve with lemon and onion rings.

recipes.name: Lucknowi Biryani
recipes.description: Fragrant dum-cooked biryani with tender meat. Awadhi pukki style.

steps.instruction: Cook meat with yogurt, whole spices until 90% done. Set aside with stock.
Soak rice for 30 min. Par-boil with whole spices until 70% done.
Fry onions until golden. Reserve half for layering.
Layer cooked meat, rice, fried onions, saffron milk in pot.
Add ghee and kewra water. Seal pot with dough.
Cook on dum (very low heat) for 30-40 minutes.

recipes.name: Keema Kaleji
recipes.description: Spiced minced meat with liver. Hearty Mughlai dish rich in iron.

steps.instruction: Clean and cut liver into small pieces. Wash mince.
Heat oil. Fry onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste. Sauté for 2 minutes.
Add spices and tomatoes. Cook until oil separates.
Add mince and liver. Cook on high heat, breaking lumps.
Add green chilies and garam masala. Cook until dry.

recipes.name: Chicken Changezi
recipes.description: Spicy Delhi-style chicken with lots of onions and tomatoes. Old Delhi specialty.

steps.instruction: Slice onions into rings. Chop tomatoes roughly.
Heat oil. Fry onion rings until caramelized.
Add ginger-garlic paste and spices. Sauté.
Add chicken. Sear until golden.
Add tomatoes and green chilies. Cook covered until done.
Add kasuri methi. Cook until gravy is thick.

recipes.name: Mutton Nihari
recipes.description: Slow-cooked mutton stew with bone marrow. Traditional breakfast of Nawabs.

steps.instruction: Fry sliced onions in ghee until deep brown. Grind to paste.
Roast wheat flour in ghee until golden. Mix with water.
Add mutton, bone marrow, onion paste, spices, and 2 liters water.
Cook on very low heat for 4-6 hours until meat falls off bone.
Add flour mixture in last hour for thick gravy.
Serve with ginger, chilies, coriander, and lemon.
